main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted on 17 October 1952, described as a yellowish-white disc, larger than Venus, observed for about 5 minutes by a USAF pilot and 4 civilians in Elko, Nevada.
interesting points: The object was described as blinking and moving rapidly with a bouncing motion., The duration of the observation was approximately 5 minutes., Reports suggested it could be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object., The sighting involved credible witnesses, including a USAF pilot and civilians., The observers could not determine the object's manner of disappearance.
